item.title: Ticket #775 (Feed urls have incorrect http ref) updated
item.dc:creator: Kafkaesqui
item.description: Should have posted under [WordPress] General...

item.title: Ticket #775 (Feed urls have incorrect http ref) updated
item.dc:creator: Kafkaesqui
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #775 (Feed urls have incorrect http ref) created
item.dc:creator: Kafkaesqui
item.description:
Syndication urls generated through bloginfo() are prefixed with invalid http scheme: http:/ instead of ​http://. Appears to be this line in the get_feed_link() function (template-functions-links.php) that's causing the issue:

$output = preg_replace('#/+#', '/', $output);

item.title: Ticket #565 (Wordpress doesn't check for duplicate comments) updated
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description: Flood protection is set for 10 seconds, IIRC. If the server has a "brain fart" and a comment submission appears to freeze for more than 10 seconds, an additional click could lead to a duplicate comment. Also, Movable Type often sends Trackbacks when someone updates a post, so it would be nice to filter out duplicate Trackbacks on an entry.

item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I have the same problem here too. See this post for details:

​http://wordpress.org/support/topic.php?id=21855

The problems persists with the latest nightly too:

​http://wordpress.org/nightly/wordpress-2005-01-31.tar.gz

We seem to be the only two people that have seen it as it hasn't been mentioned by anyone else in the support forum.

-- The Mahatma

item.title: Ticket #774 (Upload.php creates invalid XHTML a href tag) updated
item.dc:creator: cdturri
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #774 (Upload.php creates invalid XHTML a href tag) created
item.dc:creator: cdturri
item.description:
When using upload.php to upload a file other than an image, a link (a href tag) is created so the user can copy and past it into the post. However the link created by upload.php is not XHTML valid. The link created is something like:

<a href="site/file" title="" /></a>

The a tag is autoclosing itself causing the /a closing tag to be detected as an invalid closing tag. To fix this issue, line 203 of upload.php needs to be changed from this:

$piece_of_code = "<a href="". get_settings('fileupload_url') . "/$img1_name" title="$imgdesc" />$imgdesc</a>";

To this:

$piece_of_code = "<a href="". get_settings('fileupload_url') . "/$img1_name" title="$imgdesc" >$imgdesc</a>";

Thanks for looking at this bug.

Regards, Christian

item.title: Changeset [2162]: Get the title for pluggable top level admin pages.

item.title: Ticket #773 (mod_rewrite rules don't work with https) updated
item.dc:creator: kemitix
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #773 (mod_rewrite rules don't work with https) created
item.dc:creator: kemitix
item.description:
If wordpress is servered over https, then the rewrite rules must include the /index.php/ in the permalink structure. Otherwise the rewritten url becomes the http equivalent.

Explicitly stating in the RewriteRule that the protocol should be https works for me. Sample patch is in Additional Information.
